website_summaries.verdict: You're getting everything that other models have to offer, but you're paying significantly more for the added swivel seat that comes with this model.
pros: It has everything that makes us love the standard Colorado Inflatable and the Colorado XT (both the XT and this XTS model have a wheel attached for transporting)
However, the big difference is the swivel seat
cons: It comes down to how much you're willing to pay for a swivel seat

website_summaries.verdict: A solo fisherman's dream with a lot of thought to what you will need, including a nice swivel seat and removable storage packs for your gear.
pros: Side pockets can be removed to create a storage bag you can carry over your shoulder
Includes wheels to help you get it to the right launch spot
Comes with two oars that can break down for storage
cons: The seat reclines a bit, which can make it uncomfortable for long stretches on the water
A fishing boat for only one person

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you have the right pump
customer_reviews.text: Love love love. My husband and I each purchased one with the motor and battery, we have used them on multiple occasions and love to trawl with them. Plenty of storage (actually more storage than you really need) The best pump to use on this would be a K pump hand pump as they need to be very inflated to sit high above the water. An electric pump doesn't have enough pressure to fully inflate the pontoons.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C.

customer_reviews.title: Great little boat
customer_reviews.text: Great little boat that I put a 55lb thrust trolling motor on. You can see a Bambi I startled when I bumped the tree it was eating in the video (skip to 1:25)
customer_reviews.author: R. C. G.

customer_reviews.title: I really like the boat
customer_reviews.text: I really like the boat, it's exactly what I wanted, however the seller could NOT provide a bill of sale, In the state of Kentucky all boats with motors have to be licenced. Unfortunately I have to return this item. Check before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great little fishing pontoon boat for the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assembly. Works great in my local lagoon as a stable fishing platform in very calm water. I have not used it in open choppy water or the ocean. Great quality for the money. I plan to do some upgrades and mods like adding a trolling motor. Do a search on YouTube for some ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Al_Maryland

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a great boat
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a great boat. It went together quickly and easily. I can't wait to try it out on the water, but today it looks great sitting in my basement.
customer_reviews.author: rabbitaco

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boat for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This boat is awesome! I took it out on the Salmon River and a nearby lake and it performed flawlessly. Even with a 60lb marine battery, electric motor and other gear, the boat road well in the water, and cruised without difficulty. Well constructed and has a host of features other, more expensive boats don't have. It can't handle class II or above rapids, but for smoother waters and lakes, this boat gets it done.
customer_reviews.author: SWPainter

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Boat!
customer_reviews.text: This boat was everything I expected when I read about it through multiple sources! Came complete with all parts and set up takes a bit the first time you do it but after 1 or 2 times it’s about 5 min to get it from full broken down to being on the water ready to go. I have now added a custom dual rod holder set up and a trolling motor set up and this thing is awesome. For the price I don’t think you will find something better. Seems super durable and it would be almost impossible to tip this thing. Definitely recommend this product to anyone that was looking for a personal pontoon boat!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Mitzel

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as I'd imagined.
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Took a while and a little difficulty to assemble. Tubes are not as heavy duty as I'd hoped they'd be. Breaking it down for storage is very difficult. It takes two people to load on a pickup due to the weight. Not easy when in the water to reach the basket in the rear. Pros:. Handles easily in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a large person, or anyone else
customer_reviews.text: Great product and holds my big body. Very rugged and easy to put together and store.
customer_reviews.author: Amaz1234

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a float tube.
customer_reviews.text: To start off every. thing was really packaged well. The assembly was pretty straight forward. When assembled the boat seems quite sturdy. I carry it around in the back of mt short bed pickup with the pontoons partially deflated. It's so much better than a float tube.
customer_reviews.author: Shuffles

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to move around.
customer_reviews.text: Had a little bit of trouble getting wheel assembly into its receiver. Put a little grease on it but the grease got dirt on it so I cleaned most of it off. works great now. Looking forward to my next trip to the Blue mesa in the great state of Colorado!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Flynn

customer_reviews.title: very cool, turns heads, catches fish
customer_reviews.text: It took me a good 2-3 hours to assemble, use a leaf blower to inflate. A bot pricey but it is awesome for a bad back. Thinking of mounting two 55 Minnkotas on the back and ripping across many a pond. ZOOOM.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M Kreykes

customer_reviews.title: A lot of work to put together and noise when inflating one of the tubes.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to inflate and more work to put together than I expected. There’s a loud sound when I inflate one or the tubes. It floats but I don’t think I would purchase again. It does fit in the trunk of my Honda Accord.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a stillwater rig to fish from, that I could be up out of the water and have the luxury of a trolling motor. It appears to be made of decent materials for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: 1ColoNative

customer_reviews.title: Leaked after putting it together
customer_reviews.text: purchased this and spent about two hours putting it together. Discovered that one of the bladders was leaking. Not happy after spending so much money and had to cancel fishing trip.
customer_reviews.author: james stinson

customer_reviews.title: With the trolling motor in use the craft steers best by using the ores
customer_reviews.text: Great Rig have already caught fish and very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Elwood

customer_reviews.title: Salmon Slayer Pontoon
customer_reviews.text: I have taken it out a few times already and I am satisfied with the performance and quality. In my opinion, it is just a base platform to build on with accessories and creature comforts just like any other boat.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Fam

customer_reviews.title: Avid fisherman's must have!
customer_reviews.text: I just this yesterday. It took about an hour to put together. Assembly we very easy and instructions were very detailed. I can't wait to get it in the water and try it out!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Morton

customer_reviews.title: Inflatable Pontoon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pontoon after researching all one person inflatable pontoons. This is used for fishing in a lake and I love it. I power it with a 30 lb. thrust trolling motor. It moves along great and is easy to handle by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: George Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Put an umbrella on it very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable compared to a kayak And you can put electric motor on it very easy
customer_reviews.author: Michael D neff

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome to use at times.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fishing platform. However just by the nature of design limitations using the trolling motor is not easy or comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Strecker

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: I love this boat, I only wish it came with a more stable method to roll the boat around.
customer_reviews.author: jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great boat
customer_reviews.text: Great for ponds and streams ..live the swivel seat and all the pockets ..very durable
customer_reviews.author: Brian Santos

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again going to tell all my friends about this
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product have not used yet but way better then expected
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Top notch baby yacht!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Haven’t been on the water yet but I’m sure it won’t disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this! Best toy he's ever had and uses it every day he can
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Shatzer

customer_reviews.title: One pontoon flat after one use. Don't know if ...
customer_reviews.text: One pontoon flat after one use. Don't know if it was defective or I caused it. I know I did not over inflate. Ill look at it this spring.
customer_reviews.author: JL Brown

customer_reviews.title: Just our luck...
customer_reviews.text: We love this new pontoon it works great and easy to put together but we only had it a few days and saw it on sale for 150.00 less then what we paid for it at Cabelas. Darn it that's just our luck...I would recommend it the only thing is it takes two people to load it in the truck right now but I ask hoping he will make a ramp and make it easy to wheel right in. I was a little scared of getting on this as I am a bigger person and can't swim but it rides perfectly flash in water and very secure we love it so much i think we will be getting another
customer_reviews.author: jlturner

customer_reviews.title: We have used them once and we liked them, except for the fact the seat reclines ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I each bought one as birthday presents to each other. We are average size people and not overweight. We have used them once and we liked them, except for the fact the seat reclines back way too far, and is very uncomfortable. We had to put a life preserver behind our backs to support sitting in an upright position which is much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Rood

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, and sturdy. So much storage I don't know what to do with it all! One thing I would like to see, is a better rod holder system. Maybe behind the seat put a 4 pole holder. Other than that, I love this boat!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: works GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: Fish fear me now! They can't hide anymore.I fly fish with the pontoon,works GREAT !!!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Colorado XTS back in September of 2018. It's been perfect for the small urban lakes around Omaha. It's light enough to carry down to the shoreline, assemble and launch without a dock or boat ramp. This spring I brought it down from a shelf in the garage and I noticed some small 1/4" splits in both the bladders. I filled out the online warranty claim and within 2 days I received a notice that the manufacturer had shipped 2 new bladders. No questions asked! I don't know how long the warranty is but I wasn't expecting them to replace the damaged parts after almost 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Greg N.

customer_reviews.title: Classic's Colorado XTS - a superb pontoon/kick boat..
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific pontoon/kick boat. It is rugged, high quality and packed with features that anglers will find useful and enjoyable. The two removable cargo pouches are enormous and there's two bonus cargo pockets attached to the pontoons for additional storage. The 400 lb total carrying capacity is amazing. It is easy to assemble and comes with all the quality parts necessary. The transport wheel, trolling motor mount and rear battery/cargo basket round out an impressive list of features for the Colorado XTS.
customer_reviews.author: President Charley

product_meta.title: Classic Accessories Colorado XTS Inflatable Fishing Pontoon Boat With Transport Wheel, Motor Mount & Swivel Seat
feature_bullets: Colorado XTS assembled size: 108"L x 56"W x 28"H (to top of seat), Weight: 80 lbs.
Heavy-duty pontoons with abrasion resistant PVC bottom, tough nylon tops and powder coated steel tube frame
Boat and oars disassemble into a compact size for easy transport and storage
Huge storage capacity; includes 20 pockets and two insulated dring holders; seat mount and foot rests adjust to a variety of leg lengths; bladder patch kit included
